com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Interface EarlyMediaCallback

All Superinterfaces:
SBBCallback
public interface EarlyMediaCallback
extends SBBCallback

The Early Media Callback interface. The applications use this interface to notify the SBB objects after it has completed the operations during the early media whether to continue connecting or disconnect the session with the originating session or to send a redirect response to the originating endpoint. The early media callback can be obtained using the getCallback() method by passing "com.baypackets.ase.sbb.EarlyMediaCallback" as the name of the callback. The early media callback will be available to the application only if all of the following conditions are met.

  • a. The SBB implements the MsSessionController interface. b. The EARLY_MEDIA behavioural attribute in the SBB is set to true. c. The application has returned a NOOP for the EVENT_EARLY_MEDIA and the application has not yet invoked any of the callback methods.

    • Method Summary
     void connect()
              Resumes the ongoing connect operation by sending a 2xx response to the originating side.
     void disconnect()
              Disconnects the session with the originating endpoint by sending a 4xx error response.
     void redirect(int responseCode, java.lang.String[] uris)
              Sends a redirect response to the originating endpoint and terminate the Media Server Connection.
     

    Method Detail

    connect

    public void connect()
    Resumes the ongoing connect operation by sending a 2xx response to the originating side.

    redirect

    public void redirect(int responseCode,
                     java.lang.String[] uris)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Sends a redirect response to the originating endpoint and terminate the Media Server Connection.

    Parameters:
    responseCode - Response code to be used in the redirect response.
    uris - - List of URIs to be sent in the contact header.
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the responseCode is not a 3xx response (OR) The URIs specified are malformed.

    disconnect

    public void disconnect()
    Disconnects the session with the originating endpoint by sending a 4xx error response. It also terminates the Media Server Connection.
